timeline.bodyText: This looks different from how we did it in the 3.x branches.
timeline.author: jamezp

replies.bodyText: I realized as I was releasing 3.11.3.Final that I had changed the test to include 3xx statuses, which makes sense, I think, since the same leakage problem applies. There was a deadline for 3.11.3.Final and I didn't have time to change that, but I did it for 3.14.0.Final. So asking for the original behavior affects this class too.
replies.author: ronsigal

replies.bodyText: Okay. Maybe not a huge deal, but that's going to be different for EAP 7.3 and EAP 7.4 then. I'll have to back-port that fix to the 3.12 and 3.13 PR's I guess too.
replies.author: jamezp

timeline.bodyText: Should this just be in the implementation and not the API?

replies.bodyText: Well the more I think about it the example I'd done originally should work too. I forgot in general that the RESTEasy 4.x is not backwards compatible with 3.x. I should have designed this a little better because it does seem weird to have this in the API. It makes the API know too much about the implementation.

replies.bodyText: Yeah. I think we should find a way to keep this part in the implementation. It feels like implementation details are leaking into the API here.

replies.bodyText: I'm not sure I'm following. "resteasy.original.webapplicationexception.behavior" is meant to be available to the user ...
replies.author: ronsigal

replies.bodyText: In fact, maybe all of those user facing parameter names should be in resteasy-core-spi ... ?

replies.bodyText: The parameter is fine, but the way we retrieve is the implementation detail right? For example using the Config API is an implementation detail of where the property is stored.
replies.author: jamezp

replies.bodyText: Ah, I didn't see this when I just responded to your email. I guess in my mind, MP Config is like the US dollar ... the global standard. But, you're right, maybe next year will be using NanoProfile Config. ;-)
replies.author: ronsigal

replies.bodyText: Ha these days you never know :)
